alert.note: Alert for Park; Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 11:22AM MDT until June 15 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Billings MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs affecting Park County. Yellowstone River near Livingston affecting Sweet Grass and Park Counties. * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellowstone River near Livingston. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Some minor overflow occurs along the lowest areas throughout the reach of the river and across the road connecting the island with the rest of town. At 10.0 feet, Roads to Mill Creek, Cinnebar Basin and Trail Creek are covered with water. Water will also be over portions of Yellowstone Park road for 800 yards, 3.5 miles south of town, including a few farm homes. Flooding over the road to 9th Street island with water reaching some homes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 11.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 06/06/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Yellowstone River Livingston 10.0 9.1 Sun 9 am 11.1 9.4 8.1 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Safety message...A river Flood Warning means river flooding is expected to impact people and property in the warned area. Prepare for flooding impacts associated with the forecast river levels in your location. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1130 AM MDT.
